About this job

Job type: Permanent
Role: Product Manager

Job description

Company Overview

Citrusbyte is a team of craftspeople and experts who build amazing products and believe in cultivating a high degree of leadership in all of our people. We build medium and large scale applications that solve our customers' business-critical problems. 

Job Summary

We're looking for an experienced product manager to join the team at Citrusbyte. It is expected that you have lived the full product lifecycle, having brought multiple products to market.

In this role, you will lead teams of 1-2 designers and 2-3 engineers and work directly with customers to build complex custom software applications. 

Responsibilities and Duties

As a product manager, you are responsible for overall product guidance, vision, prioritization, planning, and stakeholder communication. You've got to be a quick study and become a domain expert in the areas required for your products: You need to know the business opportunities, competitors, customer pain points and technical details about each product. The Product Manager is also a guide. Clients look to you to chart out the approach that will get them results within their time and budget. 

You will work closely with our designers who actually do the design & wireframing but you should be able to roll up your sleeves to create and make changes to wireframes yourself.

  • Strategy: Collecting research, running project kickoffs, and defining business goals 
  • Consulting: Guiding clients and project teams through the right steps to get a world-class product 
  • Design: Converting ideas and goals into wireframes with a UX/UI designer, often developing the first set of sketches yourself or collaboratively 
  • Engineering: Overseeing the delivery of each project milestone by managing/collaborating with the project team

We are looking for smart, driven & talented people who want to work in a consultative environment, help our clients have great projects and also contribute to the growth of a great company. Tell us more about you!

Qualifications and Skills

Prior to an interview, we will want to review wireframes and product positioning that you worked on ( alone or in a team ) and we are only proceeding with candidates who have strong product sensibilities. 

Benefits and Perks

  • 100% REMOTE
  • TEAM RETREAT - Once a year the entire Citrusbyte team gest together at an inspiring location to meet, work and play.
  • HEALTHY BODY, HEALTHY MIND - HAPPY TEAM - We offer paid vacation and support healthy lifestyles through our physical fitness benefits program.
  • HEALTHCARE & FINANCE - We have comprehensive medical, dental, vision, and life insurance plans, plus we have a 401k plan.

About Citrusbyte

Citrusbyte is a team of craftspeople and experts who build amazing products and believe in cultivating a high degree of leadership in all of our people. We build medium and large scale applications that solve our customers' business-critical problems.

items.content:
About this job

Job type: Contract
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Industry: Academic Research
Company size: 1-10 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Are you passionate about data sharing and moving research forward? We are looking for an application developer to join our DataCite team which currently consists of two developers, bringing a mix of skills that complement the existing team capacity. The ideal candidate has experience writing open source software and a basic understanding of scholarly communication infrastructure.

DataCite is based in Hannover, Germany, but the position is suited for remote work from other places in Germany or other countries in Europe. Travel to meet with DataCite members and other partners is expected. The position includes work for projects funded by the European Commission and other funders.

Responsibilities

  • Develop full-stack product features in an open source software environment, including user-facing front-end services
  • Test, deploy and monitor applications, and react to problems.
  • Technical support for DataCite members and third parties, including supporting technical documentation.

Required Qualifications

  • 3+ years of experience with Javascript, Ruby, Java and/or Python.
  • Hands-on experience developing, deploying and maintaining web applications, including system administration, error tracking, and support.
  • Experience with project management and open source software development practices.
  • Excellent communication skills, and the flexibility that is needed for working in a small, distributed team.
  • Strong and demonstrated interest in open science and data sharing.

Desirable Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field
  • Experience in frontend development. Interest and/or experience with ReactJS and/or EmberJS.
  • Interest and/or experience in DevOps.
  • Interest to learn and use other languages such as Clojure or Go.

Please send a short email, stating your interest in the position, and CV with your GitHub username to Martin Fenner, DataCite Technical Director, mfenner@datacite.org. Applications will be considered beginning October 16, 2017.

About DataCite e.V.

About DataCite

DataCite was founded in 2009 to support researchers by enabling them to identify, locate, access and cite research datasets with confidence. By providing persistent identification for data, DataCite offers the means to connect a published article with the underlying data. In addition, DataCite:

  • provides a way for researchers to share and get credit for the datasets they generate;
  • enables easier access to research data;
  • supports the development of new services;
  • facilitates access to data not linked to a particular publication;
  • increases acceptance of research data as legitimate, citable contributions to the scholarly record;
  • supports data archiving, permitting results to be verified and re-purposed for future study.

DataCite operates mainly through the efforts of volunteers from its members and associates, along with a small staff of employees. All software developed by DataCite is released under an open source license via https://github.com/datacite. DataCite is an equal opportunities employer.

Laptop provided
flexible working hours and remote work

About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Industry: Information Technology, Logistics & Distribution, Technical Services
Company size: 201-500 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Job title:                   Technical Content Author

Reporting to:            Business Interface Manager

Location:                  Oxford (Home-based until January 2018)

Background

 ByBox is the leading provider of Field Support Logistics using its box-based distribution network in the UK. ByBox have done this using its world-beating electronic-box technology and in-house developed software platform to provide the most sophisticated field service solution in the UK. The ByBox solution disrupted the market by increasing service while reducing cost for customers, so that it now dominates the UK market.

ByBox is now taking its technology globally by building on its already impressive software development team to build a technology team capable of delivering electronic box-based solutions to a global market. The ByBox suite of mobile, web, and client-based applications cover:

  • Bluetooth electronic lockers
  • Multi-tenanted customer web-applications
  • End-user mobile applications
  • Logistics support & label/barcode generation
  • Warehouse management systems
  • Customer-facing order portals
  • Customer and 3rd-party EDI
  • In-field mobile device and scanner solutions
  • Automated testing facilities
  • And much, much more

The Position

ByBox requires an experienced, enthusiastic, and highly motivated Software professional to take on the new role of Technical Content Author at ByBox, in the Software Development department. As the first person to fill this role you will be expected to bring your experience to the team and influence how technical documentation fits into the Software Development Lifecycle in ByBox.

Until now technical documentation at ByBox has largely been in the form of written documents, been completed by a range of people, and of a mixed quality, but as our team and Software Portfolio grows the need for high-quality technical content has also increased, and deserves dedicated attention from a professional Technical Content Author. This is especially important now, as much of the documentation will be customer-focused; therefore, content must be designed and delivered with an emphasis on presentation, accuracy, clarity, and usability.

With the support of the development team (in particular the business analysts and system specialists) you will be responsible for owning and maintaining the software team's product catalogue/portfolio and producing user guides (including technical installation instructions), and content for the ByBox marketing team. Working closely with Product Owners you will produce professional documentation for our key products. You will also drive the adoption of the latest mediums for knowledge transfer, such as through e-learning tools, online video, and other techniques. The Software Development team will look to you for guidance on documentation strategy, techniques, templates, and media content. You will also have overall responsibility for guiding the structure and standards in our internal Knowledge Base Wiki.

Your duties will include:

  • Own, develop and maintain the content of ByBox Software Product Catalogue/Portfolio, producing content suitable for both internal and external audiences.
  • Be involved from the early stages of projects to understand the solution, and to understand the documentation/training requirements of the end-users.
  • Produce appropriate technical content for the end-users of our software, including Users  Guides, technical installation instructions, and integration/API guides.
  • Understand the configuration and use-cases of the ByBox products to be self-reliant in producing appropriate content (e.g. screenshots, screencasts, videos etc.)
  • Drive the adoption of other techniques such as e-learning and online videos, or other media.
  • Guide the standardization of documentation and other content and help define our documentation strategy.
  • Gather feedback on the usability of content from internal and external customers, and regularly review content and processes to ensure best practices.
  • Work with technical team to make products easier to use and thus need fewer instructions.
  • Keep up to date with changing technologies, developments and trends in the industry, attending training courses as necessary.
  • Work closely with the ByBox Marketing team to produce suitable content for their Marketing material.

You will receive full domain training where necessary; and experts in all areas of existing systems will be on hand throughout projects™ lifetimes and beyond.

ByBox is opening a new 'Tech Hub' office in Oxford (opening 2018), and this role will be based from this office, which will be a key place for knowledge transfer, testing our products and utilising demo systems. However, we have a flexible working culture, and with mutual agreement you can spend a proportion of your time working from home. There will also be some travel to other sites in the UK, namely our facilities in Coventry and Milton Keynes. All technical team members are connected remotely and communication is fully established, effective and easy. Face to face meetings in any one of our offices can be arranged easily as and when required.

Although rare, some out of hours working may be required as part of understanding the different ByBox domains (particularly operational).

The Person

The successful candidate will be an experienced technical author/writer with the following experience and qualities:

  • Background of working in Software Development teams creating software user documentation, user manuals, release notes, training courses / materials and other documents.
  • Outstanding written communication skills, with strong literacy, and a clear and concise writing style.
  • Creative, with a flair for turning technical subjects and jargon into easily understood content or training material.
  • Be a clear and confident communicator; able to interact effectively with a distributed team of other technical experts and senior representatives.
  • Passion and aptitude in technology and technical techniques, particularly content authoring tools.
  • Be enthusiastic and pro-active in learning the technologies and capabilities of ByBoxâ€™ existing software.
  • An exceptional eye for detail with a passion for accuracy.
  • Worked with both internal and external stakeholders to define suitable documentation requirements.
  • Be a clear and confident communicator; able to interact effectively with a distributed team of other technical experts and senior representatives.
  • Ability to lead and influence a variety of team members with the goal of fulfilling our documentation strategy.
  • Be self-motivated, positive, self-disciplined, reliable, trustful, honest and collaborative.
  • Capable of working effectively with minimal supervision.

Desirable qualifications and experience:

  • Qualifications in English, Communications, Computer Science, or other relevant subjects.
  • Experience in the logistics industry, or knowledge of the ByBox domain.
  • Experience working with agile software development methodologies.

Application Process:

 Please apply in writing to the Recruitment Department including a covering letter and up to date CV

NOTE:

External candidates will be required to supply details of two business referees in senior positions, who will be contacted by the Company after the first interview. Applicants must be eligible to live and work in the UK.

About ByBox

ByBox is leading the way in box-based logistics. Electronic box networks are doing to distribution what ATM's did to retail banking: Increased service, reduced cost.

ByBox uses its World-beating electronic box technology as a platform for the most sophisticated field service solution in the UK. ByBox is also the only UK supplier of box-based consumer solutions to the global postal market.

As one of the fastest growing technology companies in the UK, ByBox boasts an impressive software development team. Their current suite of mobile, client and web-based applications cover:

·Mobile Apps

·Bluetooth & Electronic lock-box integration

·Customer-facing web applications

·EDI & Customer integration

·Transport & distribution management

·Warehouse management

·Label and barcode generation

·Administrative services

·…and much more

Benefits

Home-based working for most of the Technology team
Flexible working hours
High-end kit provided including all software tools required
Training and development budget provided
25 days leave a year rising to 30 days
Several offices in UK and travel expenses covered

Job description

Dito is looking for a Cloud Solutions Engineer to join our team!   The position is remote so you will get to enjoy the luxuries and flexibility of working from home.

As a Cloud Solutions Engineer, the key responsibility will be to drive enterprise infrastructure, applications and analytics to public clouds while supporting the Sales team to develop and earn new business with prospects and existing customers.  The position may be remote but our teams work together closely with you playing a crucial role in addressing “buying” questions that will involve the design and implementations of public and hybrid cloud application architecture, as well as cloud-hosted business intelligence.  

You will get to leverage your creative juices and technical abilities around infrastructure, system and application design using web, mobile, cloud, and open source technologies. Experience across various enterprise solutions/ technology stacks (IaaS/PaaS/SaaS) and ability to provide guidance to diverse stakeholders and external vendors will be the foundation of yours and our success!  

A few details about your day to day objectives;

  • Lead change across large platforms / functional areas / organizations to public clouds.
  • Conduct architectural and engineering review of proposed IT investments/solutions to determine the strategic alignment and technical soundness.
  • Demonstrate thought leadership in cloud computing across multiple channels and become a trusted advisor to decision makers.
  • Identify, develop and document repeatable design and implementation methodology
  • Partner with project teams, vendors, support organizations, functional architects, systems specialists and other technical resources in this hands-on role driving cloud migration/adoption from inception to production implementation.
  • Collaborate with the product, data, and infrastructure architects and be responsible for the defining-designing-delivering the technical architectures, patterns, technical quality, risks, fitness for purpose and operability of technical architecture solutions.
  • Provide technical recommendations to senior executives to assist the decisions on proposed IT investments/solutions and assume responsibility for technical presentations demonstrating a good understanding of application, data, infrastructure, architecture expertise and application systems design.
  • Lead application workload and data migration, design and build interfaces between applications and other providers, as well as ownership of overall migration effort, workloads, backup and DR services  
  • Able to analyze, design, and implement cloud migration strategies without impacting business continuity
  • Project scoping skills; methods, knowledge and experience of application processes, development, implementation and deployment to achieve project objectives.

About Dito

Dito is a leading provider of enterprise IT and cloud services, and we are looking for great people who are ready and eager to help us deliver our mission: to enable companies to make the most of their resources by leveraging cloud technologies to transform and scale their business.

While Google Cloud is our cornerstone -- supporting the full stack of Google Cloud Platform, G Suite, Google Maps, & Chrome & Android solutions -- Dito works with a wide variety of cloud services and complimenting partners to solve business and technology challenges for its customers.

Our primary office is located in Mountain View, CA though we are largely a distributed team and one of the few technology service providers recognized as a Google Cloud Premier Partner, working closely with many product and service teams across Google.

The opportunities to step in and contribute are plentiful. If you work out of our Mountain View office, then you’ll be a touchdown pass from Google’s campus (not too shabby). If it’s a remote position, then all your friends will be jealous of your flexibility to work from home. Either way, you’ll get to spend time with amazing people and projects while helping our clients expand their potential through market-leading technology.

Digital Marketing Account Manager

SUCCESS agency

The Digital Marketing Account Manager serves as liaison between the client and team specialists and is responsible for supporting the client in ongoing digital marketing programs as well as  web design initiatives.

  • Ability to take large amounts of requests and prioritize effectively

  2. Are a master-organizer able to help ensure the right tasks get completed by the right people at the right time.
  3. Can lead clients in effective and current digital marketing strategy and implementation to provide remarkable ROI to the client.

  • Work from anywhere: work from your house in Kansas, flat in Edinburgh, or hostel in Bangkok (members of our team have done all three). Some of our team members enjoy the convenience of working at home. Others enjoy living the “Digital Nomad” life traveling the USA and the world. The only requirement? Great Wifi. And for the Account Manager position, you’ll be on client calls often, so wifi and connectivity is a must.

This requires structure such as regular morning kick-off video calls and communication via Slack. This is not a freelance gig. It’s a full-time position in a growing team.

We are looking for someone to help us scale the ReCharge marketing department. You will have the unique opportunity be a leader at fast growing remote SaaS startup. We have two missions at ReCharge: make it easy for people to sell subscription products online, and make our company an amazing place to work. The first mission began as three people working out of a small apartment, trying to solve one of the biggest problems facing Shopify merchants: recurring payments. Now we’re at the forefront of recurring billing software, empowering thousands of entrepreneurs to sell their products as subscriptions, and processing tens of millions of dollars in sales every week.

In two years we’ve gone from a team of 3, to a team of 35 people across the world. Our culture is remote-first, so we stay connected every day using Slack and video chat. Being part of a small, fast-growing company is exciting: the opportunities to grow and take ownership at ReCharge are endless. And we’ll make sure you have everything you need to do your best work and make a big impact. Learn more from our About Us page and About the Team Video.

npm, Inc. seeks a Digital Marketing Manager to help build awareness and spread adoption of the world’s largest software registry and the products and services we sell. The position reports to npm’s Vice President of Marketing in Oakland, California.

About you

You’re a creative, organized, and versatile generalist who will help keep the marketing machine humming. npm is not a typical early-stage “work hard/play hard” startup. We are responsible adults with diverse backgrounds and interests who take both our careers and our lives seriously. The best way to iterate towards success is by taking care of ourselves, our families, our users, and one another. We focus on tools and sustainable processes rather than on individual heroics, and we value flexibility, continual process improvements, and scrappy problem solving.

items.title: CROmetrics: Growth Product Manager
items.content:
Full-time

(Headquarters: San Francisco, CA | Fully Remote Company)

Our positions are fully remote and to ensure compliance with all applicable labor laws, are open to U.S.-based applicants only. Not hiring in Washington state, Oregon state, San Francisco, or New York.

As a Product Manager at CROmetrics, you will be a hybrid product manager, strategic thinker, account manager and data analyst. Your primary role is to partner with our clients to improve their websites through data-driven experimentation and personalization. A Product Manager spends much of their time interfacing with clients, designers and engineers. On the client side, the PM must be able to generate data-driven ideas that will improve revenue and other key metrics on client websites.

 

As a PM, you will be leading all A/B testing and personalization experimentation for the client, which includes the following:

  • Partnering with the client for the ideation, prioritization, road-mapping, design, and approval process for all hypotheses generation and experimentation

  • Diving deep into the results to deliver the data story, learnings and recommendations from the experiment

  • Collaborating with a remote team of engineers, designers and other PMs to support experiment ideation and execution

  • Managing all aspects of the client relationship from daily experiment monitoring to kicking off the renewal process to evangelizing the value of CROmetrics


In addition, as a CROmetrics team member, you will:

  • Support the professional growth of the team through leading and/or participating in ongoing training, e.g. book club

  • Engage in non-client related activities that help grow our business, e.g. writing the PM job description or delivering hypotheses and mock-ups for a sales deck

  • Actively participate in our remote culture

 

Who we’re looking for

Our most successful candidates have the following skills/experience/traits:

  • 5+ years of professional experience working in digital product management, user experience design or similar roles on consumer-facing web products

  • Demonstrated extremely strong presentation and communication skills

  • Built and delivered product roadmaps full of winning and losing ideas

  • Passion for using data to improve user experiences

  • Hands-on experience analyzing digital business data to inform decisions and plan strategically

  • Worked cross-functionally in a highly collaborative environment, preferably in a remote capacity

  • Genuinely like working with clients and their distributed stakeholder groups

  • Love product strategy, but obsessed with the details on execution

  • Lifelong learner

 

If you’re interested in checking out the swell people you’ll be working with, click here to learn more about the team.

 

If you have questions as you go through this, make notes and if we haven’t answered them by the end, feel free to email chris@crometrics.com or tom@crometrics.com.

Our Culture

  • We’re a remote company. We are spread out all over the country and enjoy the flexibility remote working affords. Want to go on a mountain bike ride in the middle of the day? Cool, don’t forget your helmet! Need to pick the kids up from school? Nice, you’ve got parent of the year in the bag. We stay connected through Slack and workcations, including one annual trip that is funded by the company.

  • Our engineers value elegant code, but move fast. We’re writing code that runs on top of existing websites. Some tests only run for a few days before disappearing (though some do so well they become a permanent part of the client’s site). If “minimum viable product” isn’t in your lexicon, you aren’t a good fit.

  • Communication is critical. We’re a remote company. That makes communication — including writing and reading comprehension — extremely important. You’ll work closely with engineers, designers and writers. This is not a simple “write specs and close tickets” gig. Successful applicants enjoy the process of defining and clarifying specs, documenting processes, improving processes, seeing their ideas and work affect millions of users, and uploading custom emoji to Slack.

  • We’re relentlessly focused on our client’s happiness. The PM is a client-facing role. Managing a client relationship virtually takes a different type of skill set – the PMs have to be both a strategic partner, the customer (represented by the data), teacher and project manager over the phone/email/Slack, all while delivering an exceptional level of service. This type of interaction is not for everyone, and we completely understand. It’s not easy!

  • We are not perfect. A the core of experimentation is the lesson to be learned from the test, whether a win, loss or inconclusive. We extend this concept to everything we do by setting the bar high for our team and fostering an environment of radical candor and constant learning.

 

This short essay sums up the philosophy we operate by: This is Professionalism (http://arches.io/2014/03/this-is-professionalism/). Sound like something you are interested in? Read on.

 

A unique application and hiring process, just like us

We’re glad you’re interested in working with us. We have a fairly unusual hiring process, but it has proven to work well both for us and for potential new hires. We have found that demonstrating basic competency is the best predictor of initial qualification for working with us, followed by actual work.

 

Our process reflects that. We’ve outlined our values and how we work above, and now we will ask you to complete a couple small tasks to show us you’re interested.

 

Create A Work Sample

The following is a typical task you would be doing on a daily basis. Follow the steps below to see if this type of work interests you and is a good fit. Please do not spend more than an hour on this task, as it is intended for you to be able to demonstrate basic competency in the core part of the job you will be doing.

 

We want to know how you think about designing elegant product solutions focused around increasing conversions.

 

Here is the website for one of our past clients: Hired.com. Hired spends a lot of money (e.g. through paid ads) to drive applicants, primarily software engineers, to their site. Their goal is to increase the number of leads/applicants that complete the signup flow and are ready to be hired.

ABOUT FINANCIALFORCE
FinancialForce is the leading cloud ERP for the new services economy. FinancialForce’ Product Security team ensures security of our products and services and serves as Subject Matter Experts for our R&D teams and partners. This team provides threat modeling, security advisory services to various engineering teams, tooling and automation to deploy AppSec Security technologies and evaluate emerging security threats, requirements and technologies related to our products and services. This position will lead the product security efforts at FinancialForce and report to FinancialForce' CTO, Platform & Architecture in San Francisco.

RESPONSIBILITIES
• Deliver and execute a product security strategy across our portfolio of products and services.
• Partner with product leadership, security organization and engineers across the organization to deliver broadly impactful security initiatives.
• Develop secure code practices and provide hands-on training to developers and quality engineers.
• Establish credibility as a trusted advisor to stakeholders including customers, executives, partners, and employees.
• Maintain strong knowledge of ongoing security threats, remediations and operational best practices.
• Guide the product organization's security and privacy initiatives by leading design reviews and threat modeling sessions. Function as technical authority for product teams for security.
• Perform black-box penetration testing and code reviews of our products, services, partner and 3rd party integrations.
• Participate in our incident response and vulnerability remediation efforts.
• Evaluate application security tools for internal consumption. Prototype new automation and tooling to improve our vulnerability detection and prevention capabilities.
• Drive remediation efforts across various engineering teams distributed in different geographies & timezones.
• Perform activities to measure & mature product security function.
• Maintain product security standards, frameworks and processes.
• Assist with other security aspects as needed including security incident response, compliance audit needs, security training and awareness.
Co-ordinate product security initiatives with our platform providers and partners. Manage external penetration testing process and relationship with vendors.
• Able to travel to other R&D development offices in UK, Spain, San Francisco and India.
• Able to work within flexible working hours to support different timezones.
REQUIRED SKILLS/EXPERIENCE
• B.S. / M.S. in Computer Science, Information Systems or related experience.
• Demonstrable successful security leadership at a cloud company.
• Proven success and continuous experience in Product Security work.
• In-depth experience identifying and protecting against web application and web service security vulnerabilities including those found in the OWASP Top 10 and CWE Top 25.
• Relevant experience in several of these languages: Java, JavaScript / NodeJS, Apex etc.
• Relevant experience in security frameworks and technologies e.g. SSL/TLS, IDM, SAML, OAuth, Crypto.
• Solid knowledge of the browser security model, web application vulnerabilities, and network security.
DESIRED SKILLS/EXPERIENCE
• A strongly self driven and motivated person.
• Familiarity with security tools such as static analysis, runtime analysis.
• In-depth experience identifying and mitigating security vulnerabilities in cloud applications.
• Familiarity with global security and privacy standards.
• Familiarity with Salesforce and Heroku platforms
We are committed to equality of opportunity for all; applications from individuals are encouraged regardless of age, disability, gender, gender reassignment, sexual orientation, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief and marriage and civil partnerships.

items.title: Aurea: PPC ad copy and Landing Page Writer ($80k)
items.content:
Full-time

(Austin)

Are you an ad copy and landing page wordsmith who consistently delivers high converting copy that is levels above your peers? Are you easily bored and excited by the prospect of writing ad copy for over 50 SaaS products and constantly iterating and experimenting? If you’re looking to join a scaling rocketship on the ground floor while working from the comfort of your home office or favorite coffee shop with people from around the globe, this role is for you.

 

Aurea Software is a rapidly growing enterprise software company that delivers transformative customer experience through a variety of world class software products.  With the recent acquisition of Jive Software, the Aurea team now includes 2,000 employees across 5 continents and a roster of over 4,000 customers, including Disney, British Airways, and Apple – all of whom use Aurea technology to engage employees and customers to create meaningful and transformative experiences.

Aurea’s growth strategy has focused on acquisition growth coupled with organic growth driven through the installed base.  Aurea is currently building and scaling a world-class new customer acquisition capability using a combination of traditional enterprise software sales and the latest inbound/outbound marketing techniques

 

Team-specific background

The team you will be joining is tasked with building the inbound portion of this new customer acquisition capability. Currently the team is working with six different products and is ramping to over fifty products in the next two years. To generate these MQLs, the team produces PPC ads, landing pages, websites, and content which attract MQLs into our funnel. This role will need to be handle complexity: not only are we operating across 6 different products, but we launch 3 campaigns per product targeting differentiated personas with unique messaging. Additionally, we aggressively test and iterate our copy and design to yield the maximum return.

 

Job Description

  • Author ad copy for multiple PPC channels (adWords, LinkedIn, G2 Crowd, Captera, etc.)

  • Author landing page copy across different enterprise SaaS products

  • Continually increase conversion rates by analyzing data and iterating ad headline copy

  • Creatively connect and brainstorm with campaign managers and creative director to bring marketing campaigns to life

  • Working closely with designer to deliver consistent end product for multiple ad channels

  • Generate multiple versions of ad copy for testing

 

Qualifications and Key Selection Criteria

Core skills and capabilities

  • Able to produce high converting ad copy tailored for target audiences

  • Comfort authoring ad copy and landing page copy across multiple SaaS products

  • Comfortable designing experiments, measuring results, and increasing conversions

  • Effective collaborator with campaign managers and creative directors

Behavioral characteristics

  • A commitment to continually improving yourself and belief that current performance can always be increased

  • Unusually high bandwidth, and comfort striving towards aggressive goals

  • Process-oriented and metric-driven contributor

  • Curiosity and openness to a remote work culture with differentiated core values

Work history/experience

  • Demonstrated expertise in written high converting ad copy for adWords and LinkedIn

  • Experience writing copy for high converting landing pages

  • Experience testing ad and design iterations to optimize conversion rates

  • Experience authoring ads and landing pages for multiple B2B SaaS products

  • History working at B2B SaaS company

 

Compensation is $80k/year ($40/hour)

Time: Full time (40 hours/week)

Offer: 1099 if outside the US and W2 if within US
Location: Global (remote)

items.title: Assistant Product Developer
items.content:
*One Third Stories* is a high-growth start-up that inspires kids to love foreign languages. We do this by creating wonderful books that start in English and _end_ in a different language, delivered each month as part of a subscription box. We’re looking for an assistant product developer to come on board and help us make even more brilliant books and story boxes in the fast-paced world of a small start-up.

One Third Stories was "started by two friends as a passion project a few years back":https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1405842914/learn-languages-through-stories/description. We’re still a small team, but these days we work with amazing illustrators, authors, translators, narrators and teachers to create good old-fashioned bedtime stories that give children access to the wonderful world of foreign languages.

You might not have loads of experience in children’s publishing but you’ve got a good eye for what works and big ideas for the sort of books you want to make one day. You’re excited by getting involved with a whole new way of publishing and ready for the challenge of taking a project from an initial idea to a product that delights children and parents alike.

*This job will be for you if…*

- You’ve got a couple of years experience in the children's publishing industry but you’re a little fed up of being a small cog in big machine.

- You’re one part daydreaming, story-scribbling free spirit and one part outrageously organised deadline deadeye.

- You’ve got great written communication skills, an eye for design, and a really strong pun game.

- Your attention to detail is putting a strain on some of your friendships because you keep printing out Whatsapp conversations and correcting them in red pen.

- You’re interested in exploring new ways of telling a good story and keeping kids entertained. Podcasts? Videos? Puppet shows? You’re up for experimenting.

- You love learning new things and don’t mind mucking in wherever another pair of hands is needed.


*You’ll be responsible for...*

- Working closely with our Creative Director to shape our publishing plan, commission new titles, and influence the direction of One Third Stories’ entire product range.

- Planning activities that are educational, entertaining and capable of keeping a six year old busy for hours.

- Writing and editing copy for activity books, our website, adverts, blogs, blurbs, staff tattoos...you might even take a crack at writing the odd story yourself.

- Liaising with authors, illustrators, translators, proofreaders, and graphic designers to ensure every Story Box is top quality, on schedule, and in budget.

- Talking to our customers to find out how we can improve each of our story boxes before coming up with a plan to implement these changes before the next print run.

- Good, clean, administrative fun including laying up books for print, managing freelancer contracts, triple-checking proofs, keeping up on industry trends, and organising creative assets.


*If you have this that would be great (but no worries if not)*

- Some level of proficiency in another language, particularly French or Spanish.

- Any experience working with children, especially in an educational setting.

- A decent level of experience across the Adobe suite, particularly InDesign and Photoshop.


*What do you get?*

- A budget allocated for you to learn anything you think might improve your performance or skillset.

- Three ‘Duvet Days’ a month to work from home so you don’t have to worry about commuting when you don’t feel like leaving bed (or are a tad hungover).

- You’ll be based out of an abandoned railway station in Camden Town (bohemian we know) with a bunch of other start-ups with the odd party here and there.

- Competitive salary with the opportunity to grow rapidly and take on additional responsibilities.


*To apply, please email jonny@onethirdstories.com with your CV and a covering letter*

Box -London

items.content:
Content and Search Marketing Specialist

Posted Oct 5

Hubstaff
Headquarters: Remote
https://hubstaff.com/

Hubstaff runs a blog, a website and various related web properties. Organic search is driving traffic to our websites, some of that traffic buys our SaaS time tracking and project management products services.The main website and blog perform well across a range of keywords, and we have a plan to increase that further.

We want to grow traffic to the website by understanding and meeting user search intent via good onsite and offsite SEO.

Choosing and optimising for keywords in a conversion focused way has recently been formalised into a process and is largely Data driven. That process requires someone to run and improve it end to end. We have v1 of that process, and are looking for the right person to run it!

Areas of Responsibility:

SEO. Your sole responsibility is SEO. Your focus will 100% on driving traffic through organic search. You will run the existing process, and work with the head of SEO, and the content team to iterate and improve on it over time. We will provide all the tools, and guidance you need.

This role requires someone who is comfortable with communicating with many different types of people, from skyping developers, to writing content, and replying to link requests etc...

The process In Pre-production:

  • Keyword Research, Data Gathering, Assessing keywords and pages according to a set of guidelines and metrics
    Creating recommendations for actions on new keyword topics, Managing potential SEO issues such as cannibalization.
  • Managing a list of prioritised SEO content topics, and feeding the content production team with these topics
  • Contributing to SEO content specifications
  • Setting up using keyword to rank tracking
  • Providing ongoing optimisation recommendations for existing Keywords

In Post-production:

  • Following a checklist for all new content to help amplify content’s performance in search
  • Do some Basic Link building (where required)
  • Optimizing page content
  • Monitoring of Rankings using SemRush
  • Casual Monitoring of Conversions (woopra)
  • Managing onPage and OnSite changes to optimize post, such as internal linking.

Ideal Candidate:

The ideal candidate is a smart motivated junior to exec level SEO who must:

  • Have good written english and excellent communication skills.
  • Have experience in keyword research.
  • Have experience using google search console
  • Understand basic formulas and enjoys using google sheets (or excel)
  • Understand technical SEO principles
  • Understand content focused SEO principles
  • Functional HTML knowledge
  • Have experince with google analytics
  • Have experience building links
  • Focus on deliverables and output

Nice to haves:

  • Experience working in SaaS or for digital products is bonus.
  • Experience marketing, in or using, time tracking and project management tools
  • Experience using SEMRush and Woopra
  • Familiar working in Sprints in Trello like environments

The remote team:

Hubstaff is a 100% remote company and this is a remote working role, so you must be confident and able to demonstrate that you can work independently, and communicate efficiently with team members in USA, Canada, Portugal, UK, Romania, and India.

You must be available to work on hours with a overlap with UK and USA where your main contacts will be. The flip side of this is you get freedom to work from where you like, when you like, and focus on being productive rather than having a lot of meetings.

Ongoing:

This role is an ongoing one, reporting to the marketing operations manager, and founders. We are looking for someone to join our team. We are freelancer and contractor friendly, but need someone who is committing the majority of their time to us, long term.

We expect the role to provide 25 to 40 hours a week, but the total amount depends on you, and can adapt over time.

Hotjar

Note: Although this is a remote position, we are seeking candidates in the following timezones only: Europe (UTC+0 - UTC+4); US (EST or CST only).

About Hotjar
Hotjar is a 100% remote organisation headquartered in the Mediterranean on the island of Malta. Our company vision is to change the way the web is built and improved by democratising user analytics and feedback. Our core product is free and available to anyone with an internet connection.

About this Opportunity
We’re looking for a passionate and hands-on Outreach Marketer to build meaningful relationships at scale with our users, communities, industry influencers and partners. You’ll be responsible for sharing our point-of-view and story, and promoting our content so Hotjar can be trusted as the the authority in its field.

In this role, you will be the essential link between Hotjar and millions of marketers, designers, developers and leaders, across the world, who could benefit from hearing about and reading our content when trying to solve their biggest, most painful challenges.

This is an excellent remote career opportunity in a key role with a fast-growing and innovative tech-startup. This role is situated in the Content Marketing team and will report to the Director of Marketing.

As the Outreach Marketer, you will:
  • Develop, test, and execute Hotjar’s content outreach strategy
  • Identify the right people to reach out to for each individual outreach campaign
  • Craft personal outreach campaigns to build interest before our content is published and to promote it once it is live
  • Get in touch with people of interest wherever they are, using, for example, personal emails, social mentions, calls, or face-to-face meetings
  • Collect feedback from “beta readers” to improve our content
  • Build long-term relationships with thought leaders, partners, and communities
  • Measure and report on the results of your outreach efforts to the team
  • Conduct research about our audience by interviewing and surveying our readers
  • Take risks and try new approaches regularly
  • Collaborate with the Demand Generation team to promote our content on paid channels
  • Collaborate with the Content Editor and Content Strategist to ensure that the tone and style of the outreach campaigns are aligned to the rest of the content
  • Work with the Marketing Team and contribute to Hotjar’s Marketing Strategy

Compensation Range
The budgeted compensation range for this role is €50,000 to €70,000 annually. Ranges are based on market research and are equitable to other roles within Hotjar. The actual compensation offered to a successful candidate will be based on relative experience and skills. At this time we are only able to provide official employment status to those located in Malta. All other candidates will join our team as full-time consultants and will be responsible for paying any taxes or applicable fees where they reside. 

Requirements

items.title: France Marketing Manager
items.content:
GoCardless is building a new global network for recurring bank-to-bank payments. We’re cutting out the intermediaries and linking together direct debit schemes from around the world to create a simple way of collecting payments directly from customers’ bank accounts.

Our API powers recurring payments for companies like the Financial Times, Thomas Cook and Nutmeg. It also enables partners including Quickbooks, Xero and Sage to help small businesses to save countless hours spent chasing customers for payments. We currently process £3.5bn each year for over 30,000 organisations across the UK and Europe - and we’re growing over 100% year over year.

We’re London-based, and backed by some of the world’s leading investors including Balderton Capital, Accel Partners, Notion Capital, Passion Capital and Y Combinator.

We’re looking for a talented and passionate French Marketing Manager to drive awareness and adoption of GoCardless in France. Focusing on our target segments you’ll be responsible for creating and executing on the marketing strategy generating interest and driving leads and revenue.

*THE ROLE*

Working closely with the French General Manager and sales team, you will be responsible for developing and implementing the French marketing strategy to deliver on the the agreed goals for France. Owning the French marketing budget, you’ll be responsible for planning and implementing specific activities to drive awareness of GoCardless and generate a consistent stream of quality leads and customers to meet the revenue targets.

Supported by the wider Marketing team and a network of freelancers and/or agencies you’ll execute and optimise on campaigns to ensure we’re attracting and retaining the right type of businesses within our core target segments.

*WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR*

We’re looking for a self-starter, excited by an opportunity to grow a rapidly expanding UK business in a relatively new market. We’d love to hear from you if you have an entrepreneurial spirit, enjoy working in small, autonomous cross-functional teams and are willing go the extra mile to get a job done.

*You should apply if*:

* You have a strong marketing background in B2B businesses in the French market.
* You are experienced in working across multiple marketing channels, optimising the mix and the messaging for different audiences.
* You are commercially astute and results driven, with strong quantitative analytical skills using tools such as Google Analytics and Tableau.
* You have experience and are comfortable owning social media channels and monitoring engagement levels.
* You are customer focused ensuring that your messaging and communications resonates with the target audience generating quality leads and long lasting relationships.
* You are a self-starter who thrives on working independently with small cross functional teams and is comfortable with working remotely from the central business.
* You have excellent communication and written skills and enjoy creating and editing great content.
* You’re able to work across multiple teams and manage both agencies and freelancers.
* French mother tongue and fluent in English mandatory, German or Spanish knowledge a plus.

Our team comes from a variety of backgrounds, and we embrace diversity – if you’re unsure, please apply.

items.title: Clever, nice person for analyst role in friendly VC-backed startup
items.content:
*About Koru Kids*

Koru Kids is on a mission to improve childcare in London. We’re making it easier and more affordable for families to access flexible and high quality childcare, by helping them share nannies with other families. This helps bring down the cost of childcare for the parents, means the nanny gets paid more, and gives the children a new friend to play with. Parents have responded enthusiastically, and our network of families is growing very fast.

We are backed by fantastic investors, including top venture capitalists and business angels such as Michael Pennington the founder of Gumtree. We won the South of England region in the ‘Best of Britain’ awards 2017, and are currently shortlisted for several awards: the UK Business Awards 2017 as ‘Disruptor of the Year’, and in the Best Women Awards 2017 as ‘Best New Business’, ‘Best Technology’ and ‘Best company working with children and families’.

*About the Team*

We have an informal, hard-working and kind team culture.

Our founder is Rachel Carrell, the former CEO of DrThom.com, the world’s largest online doctor service, which she grew to over 1.3m paying users in 3 countries. She’s an Oxford alumn, ex-McKinsey, a Rhodes Scholar and a WEF Young Global Leader.

Rachel’s joined by an amazing team with backgrounds including Cambridge, UCL, BCG, KPMG, and some of London’s top startups. We take great care with who we hire and all team members are superbly talented. If you’re brilliant AND humble, you’ll fit right in.

We work from a beautiful co-working space near Old St in central London. The office has free snacks and drinks, a gym and showers, bike storage and a programme of social events.

*About the role*

We are growing really fast, and we need someone with a strong numerical/analyst background. Part of the role will involve supporting the Head of Operations on payroll and payments, which is a critical part of the business. Part of the role will also be wider operations, which includes helping with recruiting and matching nannies to families. Your day might be spent partly in Excel, partly in Google Sheets, partly in some other software that you suggest to us, partly emailing parents and nannies, and partly talking to them over the phone. You'll find the work is varied -- some of it will be quite repetitive and boring (although really important!), and some of it will be fascinating and exciting.

You’ll have lots of freedom to reflect, analyse, experiment, innovate and improve the way we do things. You’ll be encouraged to think about human psychology, ‘nudges’, messaging and marketing, tracking and analysing data, algorithms and automation – all as part of the job as we improve the way matching works. We’ll welcome your ideas.

You’ll get exposure to all other parts of the business including marketing, finance, and software. At times you might help out with tasks related to these things as well. You’ll be a core member of our team, and you’ll get all the training, coaching and support you need to do your job well. We’ll invest in your development and help you succeed.

Your normal hours of work will be 830am to 6pm, although there may be times when late nights are required to cope with particular ‘spikes’ in demand. We know you have a private life and other commitments and we work as a team to make sure everyone has a good balance. You’ll normally work from our offices near Old St, although if you like to occasionally work from home that’s totally fine too.

3 reasons this role is great:
*You will learn a TON. Customer-facing operations will be your main focus, but you’ll get plenty of exposure to marketing and other aspects of the business. You’ll learn how to found a business, about operations, marketing, technology, and finance. You’ll also be surrounded by other startups trying to grow. If you want to, you can get stuck into the London startup scene, with its evening meetups and events, which is incredibly dynamic and fun.
*You’ll be making a huge difference to the everyday lives of parents in London. We’re building a business that will profoundly benefit children, women, and families.
* We’re well-connected in the startup world, so working with us will open lots of doors for you even if you leave. We’ve got a strong track record of helping people we’ve worked with

*About you*
We’re after an all-rounder who is clever, practical, positive and nice. We don’t mind what degree you’ve done, as long as you’ve done well in it -- but we'll be looking for something in your background that shows that you're strongly numerate. We’ll also be looking for evidence of drive, aspiration, spark and energy in the extracurricular stuff you’ve done.

*Essential skills*
* You like working with numbers and data. We love people who love analysis
* You have fantastic attention to detail and an ability to get things 100% correct where it really matters -- like payroll and payments
* You’re comfortable speaking to new people, both in person and on the phone
* You’re able to write clearly, simply and accurately, with perfect spelling and grammar
* You can work at a fast pace and under pressure
* You’re emotionally intelligent. Although you’ll like to talk, the most important thing you’ll do is listen. Choosing childcare is an emotional decision, and you’ll need to help parents through the process
* You’re a problem-solver. As we are a young company, there aren’t many fixed processes yet. That means you can create new processes, make suggestions, and tell us we’re doing things wrong
* You roll with it. You understand that startups are unpredictable environments. You are comfortable with a degree of chaos
* You’re nice. You get that no player is bigger than the team. You fit right into our culture of supporting and helping each other.

items.title: Solution Architect - Atypon Systems, Inc - Remote
items.content:
Solution Architect
Atypon Systems, Inc -Remote
Atypon (www.atypon.com) is a leading technology partner to the online publishing industry. Its customers are companies with a focus on publishing or distributing digital content in significant volumes, including scholarly, professional, and B2B publishers, and major financial services and media providers. Founded and headquartered in Silicon Valley, it has 6 offices across US and Europe.

We are currently looking for Solution Architects in the greater London area who can travel one day a week to our Abingdon, Oxford office and telecommute from home on the remaining days.
This role involves interacting with client staff to gather business requirements, propose solutions incorporating existing and new functionality of our state of the art publishing platform. The Solution Architect forms a bridge between client staff, product management and engineering.
It is an ideal job for a senior developer or tech lead with excellent communication and people skills looking to move into a more client facing role.

RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Interact with clients’ various constituencies to interpret and evaluate business requirements, and propose technology solutions.
  • Write solution/technical specification for engineering.
  • Identify the need/opportunity for platform extension with new features and functionality and bring it to the attention of product management.
  • Work in cross-functional internal teams (engineering, quality assurance, ops, product management, project management, business) to develop new solutions.
  • Evaluate and prototype APIs for third party integrations.
  • Understand content and coordinate content conversions.
  • Understand business models and translate them into either platform configuration or specification for new implementation.
  • Understand and perform data migrations.
  • Propose and build UI using our state of the art drag and drop page builder.
  • Support the sales team with technical knowledge as required, including giving demonstrations and assisting on RFP responses.
  • Potentially present product capabilities and solutions to internal teams and prospects.
TRAVEL
Some travel to customer sites is required --about 10 days per year.

Requirements:
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
  • Must have experience in a directly related role (e.g., business analyst or solution architect)
  • Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution.
  • Prior hands-on software development experience (preferably, web and backend development using Java and related technologies).
  • Hold a valid passport, or be eligible to apply for one.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES
  • First rate analytical skills, evidence of translating vague requirements into actionable development items.
  • Experience in project management techniques or otherwise demonstrable experiences with managing new development to completion.
  • Excellent communication and organization skills.
  • Ability to collaborate with multiple stakeholders in multiple time zones.
  • Hands-on knowledge of XML, web services, SQL, JavaScript, HTML and CSS (HTML5 is a plus).
  • Worked on product oriented projects and release management processes.
  • Experience in software development processes, and source control and issue tracking systems.
